verses.roman:
"āmi ajña jīva,--ajñocita karma kailuṅ
tomāra āge mūrkha āmi pāṇḍitya prakāśiluṅ

synonyms: āmi—I; ajña jīva—a foolish living being; ajña-ucita—fit for a fool; karma—activity; kailuṅ—I have done; tomāra āge—before You; mūrkha—a fool; āmi—I; pāṇḍitya prakāśiluṅ—have tried to demonstrate learning.
translation: Vallabha Bhaṭṭa admitted, "I am a great fool, and indeed I have acted like a fool by trying to demonstrate to You my learning.
